questions.title: Question 1 for Class 191023
questions.main: If the air temperature is close to the dew point would the relative humidity be high or low? Explain.
questions.answer: At the  dew point air will be saturated.  The closer temperature is to the dew point the closer it is to saturation.

questions.title: Question 2 for Class 191023
questions.main: As the difference between the air temperature and the dew point increases the relative humidity:

mcq.option: C) remains constant at a value less than 100%
D) remains constant and equal to 100%

questions.title: Question 4 for Class 191023
questions.main: As the air temperature increases with no addition of water vapor to the air the dew point will:

mcq.option: D) increase and become equal to the air temperature

questions.title: Question 5 for Class 191023
questions.main: In the vertical the pressure gradient force points ____ and gravity points ____.
questions.answer: D) away from the earth, toward the earth

mcq.option: A) toward the earth, away from the earth
B) toward the earth, toward the earth
C) away from the earth, away from the earth
D) away from the earth, toward the earth

questions.title: Question 6 for Class 191023
questions.main: Explain how dew frozen dew and visible frost form.
questions.answer: Dew: when the air cools to the dew point - the temperature at which saturation occurs. Frozen dew: If the air temperature should drop to freezing or below the dew will freeze becoming tiny beads of ice. Visible frost: forms on cold clear calm mornings when the dew-point temperature is at or below freezing. When the air temperature cools to the dew point (now called the frost point) and further cooling occurs water vapor can change directly to ice without becoming a liquid first - a process called deposition.

questions.title: Question 9 for Class 191023
questions.main: Describe the atmospheric conditions that are necessary for the formation of advection fog
questions.answer: Air passing over a colder and moist surface will both be cooled toward its dew point and have moisture added raising the dew point toward the temperature.""
